chargeHist.descr: OWI (7th, 8th or 9th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (7th, 8th or 9th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Fausto R Herrera was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $889  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Def not to be at or around any establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol including taverns, bars or liquor stores. Def may work in restaurants where liquor is sold only with prior written approval of agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent & IID installed.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 6 yr.

records.addlTxt:
Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

to Br 15

Defendant Fausto R Herrera in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez. Prosecuting Atty Shaun W O'Connell appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Jim L in person and sworn to interpret for defendant.  Testimony taken.  Direct exam by ADA O'Connell.  Venue established.  Witness identified defn.  Cross-exam by Atty Gonzalez.  ADA moves for bindover, waives argument, reserves rebuttal.  Atty Gonzalez objects and waives argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds case over to Br 15.

ADDRESS INFO for Fausto R Herrera
Current: Dane County Jail,   (Effective: 07-21-2015)
Prior: 123 Blue Spruce Ln, Marshall, WI 53559

Defendant Fausto R Herrera in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez. Prosecuting Atty Shaun W O'Connell appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Jim Larson in court and duly sworn to interpret for defendant.  Atty Hurley states Atty Gonzalez was appointed to represent defn and he is in a hearing in another county.  Atty Hurley is not prepared to go forward.   No objection by State to setover.  Court concerned about defn being in DCJ and the fact that this is the second setover request.  Court inquired of Atty Hurley if his client will waive his time limits.  Defn wants to have the case set for a sentencing hearing.  Court states she can only set the case for a preliminary hearing as she is not the assigned trial judge. Court is going to consider the time limits waived.   Court finds there is a stip for additional time to be allotted.  Court will set case over to 8/4/15 @ 8:30 a.m.   Bail continued.
amended
Paid interpreter fees for services on 7/9/15 to Lynn Leazer (15TR13009, 15TR13010, 15CF1361) and on 7/3/15 to Patricio Ortiz (15CF1361 only), batch 7563.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Atty Cuevas met w/defn. previously who indicated he was going to waive his preliminary hearing but defn. now wants a preliminary hearing.  Atty Cuevas also indicates defn. wants a new attorney.  Ct. grants motion to withdraw(Atty Cuevas).  Good cause found to set over prelim.  New preliminary hearing date will be 7-21-2015 @ 2:00 as agreed upon by the parties.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be at any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 15

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Patricio Ortiz, interpreter, appeared. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed
